segment.source: How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database
segment.target: How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database

segment.source: How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database
segment.target: How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database

segment.source: How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database
segment.target: How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database

segment.source: Use the following procedure to install the reporting server on a standalone computer and connect it to the database.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to install the reporting server on a standalone computer and connect it to the database.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Before performing the following procedure you should read and understand About App-V 5.1 Reporting.
segment.target: Before performing the following procedure you should read and understand About App-V 5.1 Reporting.

segment.source: To install the reporting server on a standalone computer and connect it to the database
segment.target: To install the reporting server on a standalone computer and connect it to the database

segment.source: Copy the App-V 5.1 server installation files to the computer on which you want to install it on.
segment.target: Copy the App-V 5.1 server installation files to the computer on which you want to install it on.

segment.source: To start the App-V 5.1 server installation right-click and run appvserversetup.exe as an administrator.
segment.target: To start the App-V 5.1 server installation right-click and run appvserversetup.exe as an administrator.

segment.source: Click Install.
segment.target: Click Install.

segment.source: On the Getting Started page, review and accept the license terms, and click Next.
segment.target: On the Getting Started page, review and accept the license terms, and click Next.

segment.source: On the Use Microsoft Update to help keep your computer secure and up-to-date page, to enable Microsoft updates, select Use Microsoft Update when I check for updates (recommended).
segment.target: On the Use Microsoft Update to help keep your computer secure and up-to-date page, to enable Microsoft updates, select Use Microsoft Update when I check for updates (recommended).

segment.source: To disable Microsoft updates, select I don’t want to use Microsoft Update.
segment.target: To disable Microsoft updates, select I don’t want to use Microsoft Update.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Feature Selection page, select the Reporting Server checkbox and click Next.
segment.target: On the Feature Selection page, select the Reporting Server checkbox and click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation Location page, accept the default location and click Next.
segment.target: On the Installation Location page, accept the default location and click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure Existing Reporting Database page, select Use a remote SQL Server, and type the machine name of the computer running Microsoft SQL Server, for example SqlServerMachine.
segment.target: On the Configure Existing Reporting Database page, select Use a remote SQL Server, and type the machine name of the computer running Microsoft SQL Server, for example SqlServerMachine.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the Microsoft SQL Server is deployed on the same server, select Use local SQL Server.
segment.target: If the Microsoft SQL Server is deployed on the same server, select Use local SQL Server.

segment.source: For the SQL Server Instance, select Use the default instance.
segment.target: For the SQL Server Instance, select Use the default instance.

segment.source: If you are using a custom Microsoft SQL Server instance, you must select Use a custom instance and then type the name of the instance.
segment.target: If you are using a custom Microsoft SQL Server instance, you must select Use a custom instance and then type the name of the instance.

segment.source: Specify the SQL Server Database name that this reporting server will use, for example AppvReporting.
segment.target: Specify the SQL Server Database name that this reporting server will use, for example AppvReporting.

segment.source: On the Configure Reporting Server Configuration page.
segment.target: On the Configure Reporting Server Configuration page.

segment.source: Specify the Website Name that you want to use for the Reporting Service.
segment.target: Specify the Website Name that you want to use for the Reporting Service.

segment.source: Leave the default unchanged if you do not have a custom name.
segment.target: Leave the default unchanged if you do not have a custom name.

segment.source: For the Port binding, specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V 5.1, for example 55555.
segment.target: For the Port binding, specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V 5.1, for example 55555.

segment.source: You should also ensure that the port specified is not being used by another website.
segment.target: You should also ensure that the port specified is not being used by another website.

segment.source: Click Install.
segment.target: Click Install.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: Got an App-V issue?
segment.target: Got an App-V issue?

segment.source: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
